Linus and Luke discuss Microsoft’s new Windows 11 hardware requirements aimed at ending USB-C chaos. Starting with version 24H2, certified Windows laptops will need to support key features like DisplayPort Alt Mode, Thunderbolt, and PCIe tunnelling, making sure that USB ports just work the way users expect.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GzkxbrENoCg

title: Microsoft Is Forcing USB-C to Make Sense

Linus and Luke discuss the takedown, and eventual reinstatement, of Jeff Geerling’s self-hosting video, which YouTube flagged as “harmful content” despite containing nothing illegal or unsafe. They compare it to their own experience with an ad-blocking video removal and criticize YouTube’s inconsistent moderation practices, questioning whether these takedowns are about safety or just protecting ad revenue.

Check out Jeff Geerling's channel here: https://www.youtube.com/c/JeffGeerling

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GzkxbrENoCg

Linus and Luke discuss Intel’s new internal rule requiring all future projects to hit a 50% gross margin, casting doubt on the future of lower-margin efforts like ARC GPUs. While Intel’s aiming for financial discipline, the shift could jeopardize innovation just as their graphics division was gaining traction.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GzkxbrENoCg
